item.title: Why JD Vance Worries About Childlessness
item.description: The Republican vice presidential nominee linked low fertility to high housing costs, social isolation and a lack of patriotism.

item.title: Philips Earnings Beat Forecasts as Orders Recover
item.description: Philips’ earnings surpassed expectations, helped by insurance payments related to its sleep apnea devices, while order intake turned positive for the first time in two years, lifting shares in early trading.

item.title: Futures Gain to Start Big Week; Investors Await McDonald's Results
item.description: Stock futures were gaining to start a busy week that will bring more bluechip earnings, plus interest-rate decisions from the Federal Reserve and other major central banks.

item.title: Yen Rebound Puts Spotlight on BOJ Ahead of Meet
item.description: The yen has made a comeback right on the cusp of the BOJ’ policy decision on Wednesday, with markets pricing in cut before year-end which would aid the currency and deter speculation, Moody’s Analytics said.

item.title: Rise in U.S. Funding Needs Likely to Be Financed Via Treasury Bills
item.description: Lackluster U.S. tax receipts and higher financing needs are expected to boost net T-bill issuance in the third and fourth quarter, BNP Paribas said as it increased its deficit estimate for 2024, adding that coupon auction size increases are likely in 2025/26 regardless of the election outcome.

item.title: Stock Futures Rise at Start of Bumper Earnings Week
item.description: McDonald’s kicks off the earnings deluge in a week that will also include rate decisions from the Fed and other major central banks.

item.title: Stock Futures Rise at Start of Bumper Earnings Week
item.description: McDonald’s kicks off the earnings deluge in a week that will also include rate decisions from the Fed and other major central banks.

item.title: Bank of Japan to Meet as Volatile Yen, Sluggish Economy Fuel Rate Hike Debate
item.description: With policymakers split on whether rate hikes will help or hurt consumer spending, question marks remain around what the Bank of Japan will do to bolster the economy.

item.title: Mounting Mid-East Tensions Support Oil Prices
item.description: Oil prices were getting support from rising tensions in the Middle East and the possibility of OPEC delaying an expected scale-back of production restrictions, Swissquote said.

item.title: Venezuela's Maduro Declares Victory and Third Six-Year Term After Disputed Election
item.description: Strongman Nicolás Maduro claimed an unlikely victory in the presidential election in a result that opposition leaders contested, saying the regime had likely falsified the vote count.

item.title: Pearson Expects Full-Year Results In Line With Views
item.description: Pearson said it was on track to meet its full-year financial forecasts despite reporting flat underlying earnings in the first half.

item.title: Miguel Cardona and the Hatch Act
item.description: The Education secretary attacks Republicans in a letter to student loan recipients.

item.title: Gold Gains as Rate-Cut Hopes Grow Ahead of Fed Meeting
item.description: Gold futures edged up as hopes for a U.S. interest-rate cut grow ahead of the Fed meeting this week, while copper continued to weaken after dropping last week on concerns over Chinese demand.

item.title: Heineken Hit by Chinese Investment Writedown
item.description: Heineken shares fell after the Dutch brewer said a significant impairment in China weighed on its net earnings, while its updated guidance came in below market expectations.

item.title: Inside the Race to Mine $92 Billion Worth of Deep Sea Minerals
item.description: The controversial race to mine the deep sea is ramping up around the world. Here’s why Norway is taking a leading role.

item.title: America's Post-Covid Factory Boom Is Running Out of Steam
item.description: Companies are laying off employees and cutting production to counter falling orders and rising inventories.

item.title: Tuareg rebels in Mali killed dozens of Russian mercenaries in what appeared to be one of the deadliest attacks on Russian personnel in Africa since Moscow first sent Wagner Group fighters there in 2017.
item.description: Tuareg rebels in Mali killed dozens of Russian mercenaries in what appeared to be one of the deadliest attacks on Russian personnel in Africa since Moscow first sent Wagner Group fighters there in 2017.

item.title: Smoke from wildfires ripping through the U.S. and Canada has created air-quality issues in parts of the West, with officials warning of reduced visibility in some places.
item.description: Smoke from wildfires ripping through the U.S. and Canada has created air-quality issues in parts of the West, with officials warning of reduced visibility in some places.

item.title: Smoke from wildfires in the U.S. and Canada has created air-quality issues in parts of the West, with officials warning of reduced visibility in some places.
item.description: Smoke from wildfires in the U.S. and Canada has created air-quality issues in parts of the West, with officials warning of reduced visibility in some places.

item.title: Congress is again facing a deadline to fund the government without a clear plan, raising the specter of a government shutdown on Oct. 1 if no new legislation is approved.
item.description: Congress is again facing a deadline to fund the government without a clear plan, raising the specter of a government shutdown on Oct. 1 if no new legislation is approved.
